Def.Name: European Mountain-Ash
Def.Description: Small tree growing 15' - 30' tall with a rounded crown. Trunk can grow up to 12" in diameter.
Def.Leaves: Alternate, pinnately compound, 4" - 8" long; leaflets, 9 - 17, finely toothed margins, 3/4" - 2" long, about 1/3 as wide, dull green with whitish hairs below; yellow in autumn.
Def.Twigs: Reddish brown, white hairs, spur shoots on branchlets; terminal buds, 1/2" long, white and wooly.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Fruit: Pome, bright orange or red, 3/8" in diameter, clustered, mature in autumn.
Def.Bark: Dark gray with dark lines or dots, smooth or slightly scaly, aromatic.
Def.Range: Very cold tolerant and can be found at high altitude in the mountains. Some say higher that any other tree.
Def.Remarks: Very nice ornamental tree. The berries are quite bitter and are used to make jams and jellys. Good to pair with game and venison.
